entry.title: End-to-End Due Diligence in Supply Chain
entry.content:
End-to-end supplier due diligence is the foundation of resilient supply chains. The process (from selection to segmentation and management) involves carefully evaluating and selecting suppliers based on their ability to fulfill your business needs.  

The world’s largest companies, from Apple to Nvidia, perform due diligence to ensure they align with the strongest suppliers. But with many supplier risk areas to assess—from quality and assurance to cyber readiness and ESG adherence—how can organizations streamline the process and detect when risk accurately? By focusing on supplier financial health.  

Financial health assessments underpin all risk areas. A supplier facing financial challenges compromises quality, cybersecurity, and regulatory compliance. These issues trickle through the supply chain, impact your operations and damage your credibility. 

Organizations can protect themselves by incorporating financial assessments, such as financial health ratings. Financial health ratings, or FHR’s, analyze the financial statements of a supplier and assess their operational resilience and risk of default and disruption. They give businesses the insights and expertise to determine whether a supplier is a strong partner in the long-term or is likely to let them down. 

Baking financial health assessment into due diligence process has multiple benefits: 

Stronger risk mitigation: A supplier's financial health tells you more about their core strength and operational ability to respond to the many external and internal pressures businesses come under. 

Regulatory compliancy: All supply chains are subject to numerous regulations including labor laws, esg, quality and safety standards. Suppliers with insufficient means struggle to uphold regulatory requirements exposing your business to risk of penalties. 

  • Transparency: Visibility into a supplier’s financial statements fosters greater levels of trust and strengthens the relationship. 
  • Consistency: Sustained quality across batches of materials and components if reliant on the financial health of the supplier and their ability to purchase adequate raw materials.  
  • Cost efficiency: These measures combine to reduce the risk of defects, recalls, late deliveries, production disruption and the need to back-fill orders or replace a supplier at short notice. These failures are avoidable costs.  

While initial due diligence is essential, it is equally important to maintain ongoing financial oversight of your suppliers. A supplier that was financially sound during the onboarding process might encounter challenges later, especially given today’s economic factors of persistent inflation and high interest rates. Implementing regular financial health assessments (recommended twice-yearly reviews) helps ensure that your partners remain stable and reliable. 

By consistently monitoring your suppliers' financial performance, you can ensure that risk is mitigated, operations are streamlined, and costs stay down by keeping disruption at bay. 

In today’s volatile market, end-to-end due diligence is no longer a nice-to-have, it’s a necessity. By implementing financial health assessments into due diligence processes, you can protect your business from a wide range of supplier risks and strengthen your operation.

entry.title: SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance & Supplier Risk 2411 Release: Key Feature Highlights
entry.content:
Hello SAP Ariba community!

We're excited to unveil the innovative features included in SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance as well as Supplier Risk for the upcoming 2411 release. These enhancements are designed to further streamline your supplier management processes and risk assessment capabilities. Let's dive into the details of these new functionalities!


Intelligent Recommendations Based on Supplier Risk Score

SAP Ariba Supplier Risk now provides intelligent recommendations for suppliers experiencing significant changes in their risk scores. This feature ensures that buyers are proactively alerted to potential risks, enabling timely action to mitigate these risks.

The "Recommendation" section on the dashboard lists these suppliers, allowing buyers to create findings or ignore based on the intelligent analysis provided. A new "Recommendation" section has been added to the SAP Ariba Supplier Risk dashboard. Pop-ups detailing the percentage change in risk score and action options (create finding/ignore) are now available for each recommended supplier.

SAP Ariba Supplier Risk dashboard new recommendations section

Self-Assessed Questionnaire Assessment Notification To All Relevant Suppliers

Buyers can now send Self-Assessed Questionnaires to both registered and non-registered suppliers in SAP Business Network, ensuring comprehensive participation and data collection. Suppliers receive an email invitation with a direct link to the questionnaire, facilitating quick and easy completion. The Engagement request page now includes a "Supplier type" filter (All, SBN, Non SBN) for differentiating suppliers based on their registration status in SAP Business Network.

SAP Business Network Certificate Information in the Supplier Profile Summary

This feature provides added visibility into supplier-related certificates maintained in SAP Business Network profiles. These certificates are shown in a new “Business Network Certificates” panel, providing additional data points for supplier assessments. Clicking the panel opens the supplier's SAP Business Network profile in a new tab, displaying certificate details.

Business Network Certificates panel in the supplier profile summary

Custom Risk Categories in the Supplier Profile Summary

The inclusion of custom risk categories in supplier profile summaries allows organizations to consider risk factors unique to their requirements. The supplier profile summary now include exposure information for the top four custom categories, providing a more tailored view of supplier risk exposure. Support is available for up to 25 custom risk categories, and the top four categories by weight (or alphabetically if weights are equal) are now displayed in the Risk Exposure area of the profile summary banner.

Ability to Save Internal Supplier Registration Forms as Draft

Users now have the option to save their progress on internal supplier registration questionnaires, allowing them to return and complete the form at their convenience without losing data. This feature simplifies the process, reducing the likelihood of incomplete submissions. A new "SAVE" option on internal forms enables users to save all answers as drafts.

These exciting features are aimed at enhancing supplier management, improving risk detection, and providing more visibility into supplier credentials. We encourage you to explore these new enhancements and integrate them into your workflows for maximum benefit. Stay tuned for more updates and insightful blogs. Don't forget to subscribe to our bloggers for the latest updates!

entry.title: SAP Ariba 2411 Release Key Innovations Preview
entry.content:
Hello SAP Ariba community!

We're thrilled to announce some fantastic new features and enhancements for Q4 2024 across various SAP Ariba modules. These updates are designed to streamline your procurement processes, enhance supplier management, and provide deeper insights into supplier relationships. Let's take a high-level look at the most impactful innovations in this release.

For those of you wanting to explore specific functionalities in detail, we have provided links to dedicated blogs that dive deeper into each area. Let's take a look!

SAP Spend Control Tower

We're excited to share the latest development with you SAP Spend Control Tower. This new tool is designed to merge all your payment and supplier data into a single source of truth, enriched with AI-enabled spend classification and supplier insights. With intuitive dashboards and advanced machine learning models, it’s easier than ever to streamline our processes, cut procurement costs, manage supplier risks, and keep an eye on our diversity and sustainability goals.

Having a unified data source might just be the key to overcoming some of our biggest challenges. SAP Spend Control Tower takes the powerful analytics and reporting capabilities of the old SAP Ariba Spend Analysis solution and pushes them even further. If you're curious to learn more about how it could help us transform our spend management, I'd recommend checking out the full details on our SAP Spend Control Tower product page.

Spend overview dashboard in SAP Spend Control Tower

SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance and Supplier Risk

Intelligent Recommendations Based on Supplier Risk Score

SAP Ariba Supplier Risk now offers intelligent recommendations for suppliers experiencing significant changes in risk scores. These new insights help buyers proactively identify and mitigate potential risks.

New recommendations section in the SAP Ariba Supplier Risk dashboard

SAP Business Network Certificate Information in the Supplier Profile Summary

The supplier profile summary now features added visibility into certificates maintained in SAP Business Network profiles. The new “Business Network Certificates” panel provides additional data points for supplier assessments, offering a comprehensive view directly from their SAP Business Network profile.

Business network certificates in the supplier profile summary

See the SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance & Supplier Risk 2411 Release: Key Feature Highlights blog for more information on these and other supplier management features

SAP Ariba Source to Contract

Enhancements to Generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) in SAP Ariba Category Management

We're excited to introduce enhancements to our Generative AI capabilities in SAP Ariba Category Management. You can now selectively generate articles for tools like Category Segmentation, Market Dynamics, and Cost Structure on demand, improving performance and reducing costs associated with producing AI-generated content.

Enhancements to Generative Artificial Intelligence in SAP Ariba Category Management

Ability to Create Category Strategy Details from the Develop Strategy and Plan App in SAP Ariba Category Management

Our new Category Strategy Details tool in the Develop Strategy and Plan app empowers category managers to create and manage multiple category-specific strategy details aligned with the overall business strategy.

Category strategy details in SAP Ariba Category Management

Ability to View, Analyze, and Manage Initiatives Across Categories in SAP Ariba Category Management

Manage your initiatives through the new Initiatives Overview app, providing comprehensive tools for tracking, optimizing, and visualizing data.

Initiatives overview in SAP Ariba Category Management

 

Create Optimization Scenarios for Multi-Round Bidding Events in Guided Sourcing

Generate optimization scenarios for multi-round bidding events, including editing constraints and updating scenarios with the latest data.

Enhancements to Grading and Scoring in Guided Sourcing

Improved grading features for guided sourcing, including offline grading for primary bids and rolled-up section level grading for alternate bids.

See the SAP Ariba Source to Contract 2411 Release Key Innovations Preview blog for more information on these and other source to contract features

SAP Ariba Procure to Order

Support for PunchOut Items in SAP Ariba Shopping Mobile App

You can now purchase items from external supplier catalogs through Level 1 PunchOut catalogs directly from the SAP Ariba Shopping mobile app. This enhancement broadens your product range for mobile shopping while ensuring compliance and approvals are managed through the normal Ariba checkout process.

View and Edit Requisition Line Items in SAP Ariba Shopping Mobile App

The SAP Ariba Shopping mobile app now provides detailed line item information in the requisition details screen and allows users to edit line items directly from the checkout screen. This update enhances flexibility and transparency in the mobile requisitioning process.

See the SAP Ariba Procure to Order 2411 Release Key Innovations blog for more information on these and other features

entry.title: How to Use Splunk for Data Analysis in SAP Ariba Applications: A Beginner's Guide. Part 1
entry.content:
Introduction

Welcome to the comprehensive beginner's guide on using Splunk for Data Analysis in SAP Ariba Application. This guide is divided into several parts, each providing detailed instructions for understanding the main features and functionality of the Splunk tool. Without further ado, let's embark on the journey to enhance data analysis capabilities in SAP Ariba.

What is the Splunk?

Splunk is an essential data analysis tool that plays a crucial role in aggregating data for analysis and providing logs. Particularly for SAP Ariba, it allows the monitoring of every aspect of the application processes, specifically  to procurement and supply chain. By doing so, it can help in tracking and analyzing transaction data, monitoring system performance, identifying security threa, and gaining visibility into operational inefficiencies. Moreover, Splunk provides the capability to proactively identify and resolve issues, optimize processes, and make data-driven decisions to improve overall efficiency and effectiveness.

One of the key features of Splunk is that it is comprised of several different applications. These apps essentially consist of a collection of files containing data inputs, UI elements, and knowledge objects. This flexibility with different apps allows for various use cases and user roles to coexist within a single Splunk instance.

 Splunk typically retains logs for a period ranging from 90 to 390 days, depending on the data center and the specific index. This ensures that the data is accessible for analysis and reference within the desired timeframe.

The Splunk access URL is determined by the SAP Ariba component and data center.

List of all Splunk and Inspector Links for every component by datacenter

It is important to note that the access to Splunk is only possible with Safeguard account and only SAP employees have access to Splunk tool.

 

Key components of the Splunk platform

Indexer.

  • Processes machine data from any source
  • Parses data by an organized source type (index)
  • This raw log data is broken up into single events
  • Events are stored by the index so they can be searched
  • Run the actual search done by user

Search Head

  • Allows users to use Splunk Search Processing Language (SPL) to search indexed data
  • Distributes the search to the Indexers
  • Extracts field value pairs from events to the user
  • Can extract additional fields (i.e. regex) or transform data (i.e. stats commands) for results before it is returned to end user without changing the underlying data
  • Provide tools for reports/dashboards/visualizations

Forwarder

  • Installed on servers where data originates
  • Primary way data is supplied to indexers for indexing

    Splunk’s Architecture

    The Cloud Health 2.0 App

    The Cloud Health 2.0 App is one of the key tool within the Splunk platform, utilized by various SAP Ariba teams for analyzing application log data. This app provides support and development teams with the capability to examine log data from any SAP Ariba component

    One of the distinguishing features of the Cloud Health 2.0 App is its multitude of customized, pre-extracted and calculated fields, such as AribaThread, AribaPrealm, and Community. These fields are exclusively available within the Cloud Health 2.0 app knowledge object, enabling users to leverage them in search queries.

    In addition to field extractions, the knowledge objects within the Cloud Health 2.0 App encompass lookups, fields, and alerts, providing a comprehensive toolkit for effective analysis and monitoring of log data.

    The app's value is underscored by the fact that utilizing these specific fields in the default search app of Splunk – the search and reporting app – yields no results unless the corresponding knowledge object exists within it.

    Another benefit of the Cloud 2.0 app for users is that all dashboards and alert knowledge objects are shared across global data centers.

    Main page

    The opening of the cloud health signifies the importance of the application, which is prominently positioned at the top of the black Splunk menu bar. This feature is accessible from any Splunk application, providing users with ease of access. Within the aforementioned bar, users can find the application chooser, which allows for seamless switching between different apps. This centralized location serves as a convenient hub for app navigation.Furthermore, each application contains its own specific navigation features within the bar, ensuring a tailored user experience for each individual app.

    If someone were to wish to run a simple, ad hoc search, they could do so by clicking on the search button. This action would subsequently open the search screen in a new tab, displaying a page with the desired results. Users can then input their search criteria into the search bar, beginning with "index equals," followed by the specified index. In some cases, users may also be searching for a specific string of text.

    Upon running the search and obtaining results, a bar chart depicting the event timeline will be displayed. This chart effectively illustrates the distribution of events across time intervals. The specific timing of these intervals will adjust dynamically depending on the length of the chosen time frame for the search.

    Each individual result is considered an event, with different fields and values attributed to each one. For example, the "host" field is accompanied by a corresponding value. Additionally, there are various job functions located on the top right-hand side of the page.

Search example

The time zone displayed for specific events is based on user preferences and can be adjusted according to individual needs. To do so, simply click on your name, navigate to the preferences section, then select the global settings and change the time zone as desired. This allows users to ensure events and appointments are accurately reflected in their own local time.

Timezone

Search Assistant

The search assistant is a helpful tool that offers various selections and options for completing a search. Users have the ability to select a term from a list, continue typing, and choose between default, compact, or full view. To access or deactivate the search assistant, users must click on their name, navigate to preferences, select SPL editor, and then the search assistant.

Preferences

The compact mode provides command information as users type and displays the last five queries for quick selection. In full mode, the display provides more information and includes more text as well as examples. However, the choice of which view to use ultimately depends on the user's preference.

Search Assistant Compact Mode

Search Assistant Full mode

The next topic for consideration is the selection of time in the Search feature. When it comes to selecting the time, there are several different options available. One option is to select the time from a time picker. Another option is that real-time search is only allowed for Power/Admin users. Additionally, time can be defined in the search query using various options such as "earliest" or "latest." Time notation is also available, with "s" representing seconds, "m" representing minutes, "h" representing hours, "d" representing days, "w" representing weeks, "mon" representing months, and "y" representing years.

 Selecting Time in Search

 

In order to view a specific subset of events using the search feature, users can click on a particular bar. This action filters the search results to display only the events related to the selected bar. To clear the filter, simply clicking on any part of the white space in the bar will remove it.

Search Example

Controlling the jobs allows for various options such as pausing a job while it is still running and stopping a job if needed. Additionally, the default duration for active search jobs is 10 minutes, but they can be shared with others via a URL that remains active for seven days. The search results can be downloaded in different formats such as CSV, JSON, XML, or raw text. There are three different search modes available: fast, which only returns default field data or any required fields for the search; verbose, which returns a large amount of data and may impact search performance if used for large queries; and smart, which recommends field discovery for searches and adds new fields if Splunk determines there is enough data to add them. The smart mode also does not provide event or field data for stats searches. Overall, these options provide flexibility and control in managing search jobs and their results.

 Controlling Jobs

In order to access previous job and search history, users can click on the activity section and view jobs by the owner application or status. The search history can be found at the bottom of the search page, where users can expand and view their previous searches. This feature is particularly useful for users who may have forgotten to save a query they ran a few days ago. The search history page is designed to retain data for up to 30 days, allowing users to access any searches conducted within that timeframe.

History

Conclusion

Having finished the basic overview of the Splunk tool and its main features for SAP Ariba data analysis.  On next parts will continue to dive to this tool and will talk about Dashboards and Alerts & Schedulated Reports. . The aim of this guide is to be helpful and aid in making comprehensive analysis of any Ariba issues on a daily basis. Should you have any questions or need further assistance, do not hesitate to reach out.

SAP Ariba Sourcing  SAP Ariba Invoice Management  SAP Ariba Spend Analysis SAP Ariba Supplier Risk #splunk

entry.title: Complying to EUDR using SAP Ariba Supplier Management and SAP Green Token
entry.content:
Authors: Allan Soo, Sabrina Haller, Gloria Figaroa and Nike Klaubert

Complying to European Union Deforestation Regulation using SAP Ariba Supplier Management and SAP Green Token

Introduction

From the 30th of December 2025, large and medium-sized EU importers will be impacted by the European Union Deforestation Regulation (EUDR) requiring them to conduct both due diligence and track and trace activities to make sure that the commodity (produced after the date that the regulation comes into force) does not originate from a plot of land that has been cleared for commercial purposes. Initially announced from 29th of June 2023, the phase-in period gives companies time to prepare for the regulation.

What commodities and products are impacted?

EUDR declares that both raw commodities and products containing these commodities are subject to compliance. The commodities include:

  • Cattle, meat livestock and leather
  • Cocoa beans, cocoa powder (no sugar/sweeteners) and foods containing cocoa
  • Coffee
  • Palm oil and some of its derived products
  • Rubber, including tyres, conveyor belts and cords
  • Soya beans
  • Wood and timber, including pallets, kitchenware, printed paper, furniture and seats.

Based on these items, it becomes difficult to determine whether the item requires EUDR due diligence assessments. Purchasing activities from foreign countries requires determining whether the impacted commodity contains a product that is restricted from imports into the EU. Further details on these commodities can be viewed in the EUDR document, Annex I.

Who should be concerned?

Sourcing and procurement departments in the EU will need to begin implementing processes that conduct thorough due diligence and reporting activities to ensure that imported items are not subject to deforestation for commercial purposes.

 A large company, according to the EU Accounting Directive (2013/34/EU), would exceed two of the following:

  • Balance sheet total of €20,000,000
  • Net turnover of €40,000,000
  • Average number of employees of 250 for the financial year

For medium sized undertakings, the entity must not exceed two of the following:

  • Balance sheet total of €20,000,000
  • Net turnover of €40,000,000
  • Average number of employees of 250 for the financial year

The commission, furthermore, defines small undertakings as:

  • Firms with fewer than 50 employees for the financial year
  • Annual turnover or balance sheet below €10 million

And micro undertakings as:

  • Firms with fewer than 10 employees
  • With an annual turnover below €2 million for the financial reporting year.

EUDR reporting periods begin with large and medium enterprises from the 30th of December 2025, with small and micro enterprises beginning their reporting periods from 30th of June 2026. Any new item containing an EUDR commodity that is being placed onto the EU market from these dates will be subject to the regulation. Entities are to conduct their EUDR due diligence checks once every year and store these records.

What about Omnibus Proposal proposed by the EU Commission?

The proposed Omnibus package will not amend current planned obligations to existing and future reporting entities. Leaving EUDR largely intact.

Penalties for noncompliance?

Up to 4% of the importer’s annual turnover and confiscation of commodities or products if it is found to originate from a plot of land cleared for commercial purposes. For wood products, the exporter must have legally obtained the product for export into the EU.

Procurement’s role in addressing EUDR

Situations that require procurement to have processes in place for complying to EUDR includes purchasing a new item from any (existing or new) that contains a commodity or product that falls under Annex I of the EUDR document.

An example is the procurement of wooden office furniture, wooden pallets and chairs with SAP Ariba Sourcing and Buying, or using SAP S/4HANA to source soybeans and timber.

SAP’s solutions to complying with EUDR

SAP offers a range of sourcing, reporting and due diligence solutions to help customers comply to EUDR. SAP Green Token is designed to address Article 9 of EUDR, while SAP Ariba Supplier Risk provides assessment, risk mitigation and monitoring solutions – and aims to help customers comply to Articles 10 and 11. Fig. 1 provides an overview of the solutions SAP and partners offer to help customers comply to EUDR.

Figure 1: How SAP Ariba works with SAP’s solutions to manage and mitigate deforestation risks for sourced commodities and other products containing declared items. *Suitable partners can be found on store.sap.com by searching for “EUDR”. ** Custom Fields or Custom Risk Categories (GA 2408, see SAP Help - Custom Risk Categories / SAP Help - Enable Custom Risk Categories).

SAP Green Token and Article 9

SAP Green Token is a supply chain compliance cloud solution that enables accounting of sustainable material movements with segregation or mass balancing and tokenization for trust and compliance with recognized standards and regulations. The primary EUDR compliance capability is the use of segregated material accounting (Fig. 2) and management of the due diligence statements for EUDR.

Figure 2: Input-output track and traceability of raw commodity materials across the value chain with tokenised sustainability information to the final product.

SAP S/4HANA sourcing and PO order line-item creation leads to SAP Green Token journey for a commodity that is impacted by EUDR. The inbound claims (Fig. 3) and orders for the commodities should be supplemented with the sustainability information from the supplier proving that the commodity has not been sourced from deforested land.

Figure 3: Inbound records of the raw commodities that are being sourced into the EU within SAP Green Token solution.

Depending on whether the organization is the primary importer into the EU or an organization further downstream within the EU, the due diligence statement information is automatically uploaded into the EUDR Traces Database. Subsequently, the generated reference number is captured back into SAP Green Token.

The next step requires the exporter or processor to undergo the “conversion” of the material into a percentage of waste (Fig. 4), recycled content, EUDR commodity content, etc. that perseveres the tokenisation process. The tokenisation process converts the raw material into a digital asset containing sustainability information which can then be passed down the supply chain via segregated-balanced accounting. In this use case, you may purchase a piece of furniture that is 40% timber coming from a non-EU country. For outgoing deliveries, SAP Green Token can automatically share this information with customers via email.

Figure 4: Conversion process where the percentage of materials are classified based on certain sustainability attributes so that they are fully accounted for.

The compliance process is not complete, as Articles 10 and 11 of the regulation need to be complied to. For this, a risk mitigation, assessment and management solution are needed. This is where SAP Ariba Supplier Management comes in.

During the outbounds process in SAP Green Token, due diligence statements can be tracked with the dashboard which can be seen below in Fig. 5.

Figure 5: Outbounds process where the POs for materials, satellite JSON files and their attached statements can be monitored towards compliance.

Using SAP Ariba Supplier Risk to conduct deforestation due diligence

SAP Ariba Supplier Risk supports the buyer with risk assessment, risk mitigation and risk monitoring activities for EUDR (Article 10 and 11). The supplier’s data can be added to SAP Ariba Supplier Risk through synchronization with an integrated ERP system, supplier data file import or by supplier requests as part of the onboarding process in SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance. To assess the EUDR risk exposure, suppliers can be segmented based on the commodity to identify suppliers in scope of EUDR. The supplier’s data can then be screened with intelligent web crawling solutions and 3rd party data providers that can be integrated via custom fields using the risk category information risk category can be developed within SAP Ariba Supplier Risk as a part of a maximum of 25 custom risk categories to feed in this data. Fig. 6: shows the screening and risk categorisation of the suppliers in the solution.

Figure 6: Showing the number of suppliers that are low, medium and high risk at deforestation practices. Buyer then conducts due diligence on these suppliers through further questionnaire assessments.

To achieve a holistic EUDR risk view of the supplier, the engagement request feature can be leveraged to obtain additional EUDR specific information directly from Tier-1 suppliers. In this context, customers have the flexibility to create their own questionnaires with EUDR related questions. When selecting suppliers for assessments, factors such as the country’s: incidence for deforestation, rate of deforestation, reports and claims of deforestation, impacted indigenous peoples from land clearing, corruption/political indexes, supply chain and plots of land cleared, risk of the product being mixed with other commodities at risk of deforestation, and any FLEGT timber licenses (if applicable). This forms a part of the risk assessment process.

In case a concrete risk has been identified (e.g. a high deforestation risk), it can be addressed by creating a finding that is associated with the engagement request. The risk mitigation is supported by the application Findings and Event Collaboration in SAP Ariba Supplier Risk. A finding is raised, reviewed and assigned to internal and external stakeholders such as the supplier risk manager, external stakeholders like the individuals from the supplier’s organization or other external parties for example, NGOs or auditors. They can collaborate on analyzing the finding and execute an action plan, like requesting further information from the supplier and planning audits on sites to proactively mitigate the risk.

Embedding EUDR due diligence into purchasing processes

 Buyers must be aware of the deforestation risk of suppliers whenever they need to take a decision. By embedding the deforestation risk category in SAP Ariba Sourcing and SAP Ariba Contracts buyers can determine suppliers with a low deforestation risk in a sourcing event or award contracts to suppliers that are best aligned with their deforestation risk appetites.

Figure 7: Buyers can extract up to 25 custom risk scores (and create a deforestation risk score) from SAP Ariba Supplier Risk into the SAP Ariba Contracts workspace and SAP Ariba Sourcing, with guided sourcing capabilities (from left to right).

EU Observatory and other resources

The EU provides resources (such as the EU observatory on deforestation in Fig. 8 and 9) to help buyers and importers of EUDR commodities to track and identify high risk countries of concern based on satellite, forest imagery that is continuously updated.  Importers of the high risk EUDR commodity can determine deforestation rates via this portal. You may be wondering; how does an importer legally import any form of wood into the EU? Wood that is harvested after the 29th of June 2023 will need to adhere to the EU Timber Regulation (EUTR), which is a regulation that aims to prevent imports of illegally logged timber products.

The EU will have a benchmarking system designating countries that are standard, low or high risk which will guide buyers in conducting further EUDR due diligence activities. The publication of the risk country profiles is planned to be made available from 30th of June 2025 and an existing country classification list can be accessed here.

Figure 8: The EU’s deforestation observatory showing commercial land clearing deforestation coverage and trends.

Figure 9: EU’s Observatory mask showing deforestation metrics such as coverage and incidence rates.

These are some of the publicly available tools provided by the EU that helps buyers monitor activities for deforestation. The buyer can take these metrics and conduct further due diligence on new imports for EUDR commodities and products through SAP Ariba Supplier Risk, SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance Management, and SAP Green Token on a yearly basis.

Conclusion

Chief Sustainability, Compliance and Procurement Officers face new regulatory, cross-border challenges they need to address in a time where environmental regulations are altering their sourcing behaviours to protect ecosystems. To facilitate this level of compliance, automated reporting, supplier assessments, and material track and trace solutions are needed to mitigate both supplier and deforestation risks. Solutions and new processes need to be established to ensure prevent confiscation of goods and avert fines. SAP Ariba and partners can help you comply by offering solutions to conduct due diligence, track and trace, due diligence statement reporting and risk management.

entry.title: SAP Ariba Supplier Management
entry.content:
Key Features of SAP Ariba Supplier Management

  1. Supplier Lifecycle Management: SAP Ariba simplifies supplier onboarding and qualification processes, reducing cycle times and ensuring that supplier data is accurate and up-to-date. This is achieved through automated workflows and integration with SAP ERP systems 

  2. Performance Management: The platform provides tools for continuous monitoring and evaluation of supplier performance. Businesses can set performance metrics and track compliance, helping to identify and mitigate risks proactively 

  3. Risk Management: SAP Ariba includes robust risk management features, such as risk due diligence and proactive risk monitoring. This helps businesses protect their brand reputation and ensure compliance with regulations like the German Supply Chain Due Diligence Act 

  4. Sustainability and ESG Compliance: The solution supports sustainability initiatives by enabling businesses to assess and manage suppliers based on environmental, social, and governance (ESG) criteria. This ensures that procurement decisions align with corporate sustainability goals 

  5. Integration with Procurement Apps: SAP Ariba integrates seamlessly with other procurement solutions, maintaining consistent supplier qualification and segmentation. This integration helps businesses drive spend to preferred suppliers and reduce risks at every step of the procurement process 

Benefits of Using SAP Ariba Supplier Management

  • Improved Collaboration: By centralizing supplier information and processes, SAP Ariba enhances collaboration between buyers and suppliers, leading to better communication and more efficient procurement operations 
  • Enhanced Compliance: Automated workflows and comprehensive risk management tools ensure that businesses remain compliant with industry regulations and standards 
  • Cost Savings: Streamlined processes and improved supplier performance management contribute to significant cost savings and operational efficiencies 
  • Greater Transparency: The platform provides greater visibility into supplier activities and performance, enabling businesses to make informed decisions and manage risks effectively 

Conclusion

SAP Ariba Supplier Management is a powerful tool that helps businesses manage their supplier relationships more effectively. entry.title: AI Won’t Save Bad Data: Lessons from the Field in Supplier Management
entry.content:
Let’s be honest: supplier management isn’t always glamorous.

You know that moment when a supplier insists they’ve already registered — and you realize they used the wrong ANID (again)? Or when you're prepping for a risk review and notice half your supplier questionnaires are incomplete?

In my role in SAP Solution Value Advisory, I work with customers across industries to help them get the most out of SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle & Performance (SLP) and Supplier Risk. Every company is different, but the challenges tend to be the same — especially as AI becomes a bigger part of the conversation.

One thing I say to customers (half-joking, half-pleading) is this: AI won’t save bad data. It’ll just make your bad data faster.

If you're aiming for AI-driven insights and automation, the groundwork matters more than ever. That means:

  • Structuring your supplier registration flows thoughtfully, and using Modular Questionnaires where applicable
  • Regularly cleaning up duplicate or inactive supplier records
  • Making it easy — and worthwhile — for suppliers to participate

Set Your Suppliers Up for Success

I’ve seen too many teams stuck chasing suppliers to complete registrations, risk assessments, and questionnaires. Features like automated reminders and nudges can help, but participation truly improves when:

  • Suppliers understand what’s in it for them
  • The process is simple and straightforward
  • You provide clear guidance (even a short how-to video can work wonders)

We can’t control supplier behavior — but we can control the experience we create.


Not Sure Where to Start?

Here are a few lesser-used gems in Ariba SLP that can make a big difference in onboarding and maintaining clean supplier data:

  • Process Framework – Collect supplier info that’s commodity/region-specific, or doesn’t belong in the initial registration
  • Preferred Supplier Flags – Especially useful if you're using Guided Buying
  • Approval Workflows by Category or Region – More control without more noise
  • Supplier Data Snapshots & Reporting – Track onboarding durations, identify bottlenecks, and analyze where your process might be over-engineered.

Maybe you’re collecting data too early. Maybe some supplier types are being asked for more than they need to provide. Don’t be afraid to question whether your current setup still fits your organization’s broader Source-to-Pay process.

Data Today = AI Tomorrow

Customers often ask me:
“Will Ariba use AI to flag risky suppliers?”
“Can it automate profile scoring?”

Yes — exciting things are on the way. But AI depends on patterns. And patterns only emerge from clean, complete, consistent data. Think of it like training a chef with a messy fridge. If half your ingredients are mislabeled, expired, or missing, you’re not getting a Michelin-star meal, you’re getting mystery soup.

What I’d love to hear from you:
What’s your biggest supplier management headache? What clever workaround have you built in Ariba? How do you motivate suppliers to fill out their info?

Drop a comment or message me here in the SAP Community, I’d love to connect!

entry.title: SAP Ariba 2508 Release Key Innovations Preview
entry.content:
Highlights of Enhancements across Procurement

Joule, Your AI Copilot

As you may know, Joule is the SAP AI copilot - a virtual assistant that uses a conversational interface to help users of SAP business applications complete tasks more efficiently.

The conversational interface is brought to life with the help of these 4 interaction patterns:

  • With informational interactions we are providing our users knowledge-based results. All SAP applications in which Joule is available make their knowledge-base available via Joule, e.g. SAP Help Documentation. This is managed by SAP and offered to every Joule user out of the box.
    We're also bringing in Document Grounding with which we enable our customers to upload their customer-owned content, e.g. HR-policies, travel-policies, FAQs, and others, so that their users can ask questions based on these documents.
  • Navigational Pattern - Easily navigate SAP applications by simply asking via natural language. Joule offers you a navigational link which opens the respective application and UI in a new browser tab. In the destination, a user can open Joule again and continue where they have left with the same conversation history.
  • Transactional interactions provide our users with a direct entry point to the backend system. Triggering and influencing business processes with the power of natural language and AI. E.g. purchase orders which need to be reviewed and approved, job positions which are created or any other CRUD-interaction (create, read, update, delete) within SAP cloud applications.
  • And a 4th, Analytical pattern to enable analytical interactions based on JustAsk and SAP Analytics Cloud, enabling customers to leverage Joule for analytical queries. This is currently not implemented in Ariba.

With the Q3 2025 release, Joule is being made available in the SAP Ariba applications of Guided Buying, Guided Sourcing and Supplier Management.

Please note that AI copilot Joule in the aforementioned products will be in Early Access until September 19th, 2025 at which time it will be made generally available to customers.

For a complete list of Transactional and Navigational Joule skills which are available per application area, view our new blog: Joule 2508 Release Key Innovations

 

SAP Ariba Category Management Highlights

Ability to Set an Initiative as Obsolete in SAP Ariba Category Management (ARBCATA-463)

Keeping your workspace organized is essential for focus and efficiency. With this feature you can now manually mark outdated initiatives as obsolete, easily closing those that are no longer relevant. This means your team will see only initiatives that matter, reducing clutter and helping everyone prioritize more effectively.

Additionally, the Initiatives Overview page now allows you to filter by multiple phases—including the Obsolete phase—so you can quickly get the view you need and keep data clean and actionable.

 

Standardized and Detailed Category Risk Assessment (ARBCATA-489)

Risk management is fundamental to strong category strategies. With this feature , the risk assessment tool has been enhanced so administrators can define standardized risk types for evaluation across all purchasing categories.

The new Risk Types page on the Strategy and Plan tab

Category managers can now identify, score, and qualify each risk in detail, with information like cause, impact, and mitigation strategies.

The New Risk page that appears when you click Create on the Risk Assessment page now includes 3 sections: Assessment, Details, and Mitigation. These scores contribute to an overall risk score at the strategy and plan level, which reflects the combined risk across category, timeframe, business unit, and region. This gives category managers a structured, repeatable approach to assessing category supporting informed decision-making at every level.

The Risk Assessment page now displays a Risk Assessment Matrix and Risks table.

 

Ability to Select Tool Documents for AI-generated Category Strategy Recommendations (CATMAN-16)

Now that it’s possible (with the above feature) to create multiple Cost Structure and Market Dynamics documents, this new AI-driven strategy recommendations allows you to choose which Cost Structure and Market Dynamics documents to include, ensuring the insights you receive are tailored to your specific business needs. This accelerates the development of effective strategies, minimizing revisions and aligning recommendations with your goals.

You can now choose specific Cost Structure and Market Dynamics documents when generating recommendations for category strategy details, in cases where multiple tool documents are linked to a strategy and plan document

For further details on these innovations and more, view our new blog:  Category Management 2508 Release Key Innovations

 

Highlights from Source-to-Contract

SAP Ariba Contracts Integration with WalkMe (SCONTR-1444)

This feature facilitates the integration between SAP Ariba Contracts and the WalkMe Digital Adoption Platform. Through this integration, buyers receive on-demand guidance from WalkMe for several commonly used workflows within SAP Ariba Contracts.

This enables organizations to accelerate user adoption of technology, boost productivity, and maximize the value of enterprise software investments.

Smart walk-throughs powered by WalkMe are available for the following workflows within SAP Ariba Contracts:
  • Creating a contract workspace
  • Importing line items into a contract workspace using the Simplified Excel Import functionality
  • Creating contract workspace templates

 

Managing Baseline and Supplier Contracts for Pre-Award Negotiation in Icertis Contract Intelligence for SAP Ariba Solutions (SCONTR-1499)

If your organization uses Icertis Contract Intelligence (ICI) alongside SAP Ariba, you can now manage both baseline and supplier contracts directly in Icertis during pre-award negotiations.

We've also improved the APIs so that developers can easily copy data from one contract workspace to another.

 

Display Remaining Time for Line Items in Bid Console for Guided Sourcing Auctions and Competitive RFPs (SOURCE-2544)

This feature enables buyers to view the remaining time for line items and lots within the Bid Console page and is applicable to guided sourcing events such as English forward auctions, English reverse auctions, and competitive RFPs.

Timing matters! The bid console now clearly shows how much time is left per line item (or lot) during auctions and RFPs.

 

The changes are applicable for competitive RFP, Auction, Reverse auction bid console screens. For Japanese, dutch auctions the new column Time remaining will not show and the watch screen timer values will not change.

 

For further details on these innovations and more, view our blog: Source-to-Contract 2508 Release Key Innovations

 

Highlights from Procure-to-Order

AI Copilot Joule in Guided Buying (GUIDEB-1163) - GA September 19th 

AI copilot Joule in Guided Buying features a conversational interface designed to help users complete tasks efficiently. It leverages generative and other AI technologies to understand natural language requests, identify user intent, perform actions, and provide valuable insights.

With Joule, you can easily access information such as:

  • Requisition approval status
  • Requisition details
  • Recent purchases

You can find the Joule panel by clicking on the icon at the top of your screen. This release is just the beginning of our journey to harness AI across buying processes, driving significant efficiency gains and more for our entire user base.

Please note that AI copilot Joule in Guided Buying will be in Early Access until September 19th, 2025 at which time it will be made generally available to customers

For more detailed information please see this blog: Joule in SAP Ariba Applications

 

Enhancements to WalkMe in Guided Buying (GUIDEB-1266) 

We were excited to announce the first iteration of WalkMe in Guided Buying in the last release (2505), now to build on this momentum with an important user experience enhancement.

The WalkMe Digital Adoption Platform is now enabled for all Guided Buying customers and the WalkMe panel can now display content from SAP Companion also through some subtle UI changes.

If both WalkMe and SAP Companion are enabled, the walk me panel now displays a separate tab for each respectively:

 

Previously, WalkMe was disabled by default, and SAP Companion content displayed in a different panel.

This innovation offers more flexibility, allowing you to use the right resources and support at the right time in the most suitable way. It will help guide you seamlessly through your desired procurement processes and drive better outcomes.

For further details on these innovations and more, view our blog: Procure-to-Order 2508 Release Key Innovations

 

Highlights from Central Invoice Management

Enriched Filtering Capabilities for the Invoice List (CIM-2270) 

We know that dealing with large volumes of invoices can be challenging, especially when you need to find that one specific invoice or group relevant data for reporting and analysis. With our latest release, we’re streamlining this process even further.

Within the invoice list you can use the Adapt Filters button to add several new filters to the filter bar. For additional information on how to adapt filters in the invoice list, see Adapting Filters and Creating Variants. The following filters are now available:

  • Company Code Country/Region
  • Supplier Country/Region
  • Purchase Order

The new filters allow you to search the invoice list more precisely and accurately as seen in the image below:

 

Posting Date Automatically Updated During Automatic Processing (CIM-2920)

For organizations that use automatic processing for invoices in SAP Ariba, you likely set a default posting date—often the current date—when invoices are automatically submitted. With our new enhancement, if you have defined the default posting date as the current date, the system now dynamically updates the posting date to the exact current date right before the invoice is submitted.

We understand that sometimes, there may be a delay between when automatic processing starts and when an invoice is actually submitted. In the past, this gap meant an invoice could end up with a posting date that was out of alignment with the real submission time, potentially causing confusion or even issues with financial reporting or compliance.

With the new enhancement, the posting date will always reflect the true date of submission—even if the process experiences minor delays. This change can have a major impact for finance and accounting teams.

 

Submission of Invoices Enriched by Data Attribute Recommendation (CIM-2965)

With this feature, changes have been made to the automatic submission process for invoices enriched by data attribute recommendation. Now, when the confidence threshold for fields enriched by data attribute recommendation is between 0.5 and 0.7, the automatic submission is stopped, and you can review the fields within the invoice on the invoice detail page. You can then manually submit the invoice or adjust the invoice before submitting.

Data attribute recommendation can automatically enrich and complete the following fields in draft invoices:

  • G/L Account
  • Cost Center
  • WBS Element

Data attribute recommendation is a machine learning service that is trained with a set of invoices that you select. Once data attribute recommendation is trained and activated, SAP Ariba CIM can automatically complete missing fields in draft invoices using the data learned during the training.

For further details on these innovations and more, view our blog: Central Invoice Management 2508 Release Key Innovations

 

Highlights from Supplier Management & Risk

Supplier Management Integration with WalkMe (SLP-2265)
This feature integrates SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance and SAP Ariba Supplier Information and Performance Management (new architecture) with WalkMe Digital Adoption Platform. Users can take advantage of easy-to-understand guidance powered by WalkMe.

Supplier Management WalkMe integration includes several standard smart walk-throughs from SAP Ariba for common workflows. Customers can also choose to develop their own content by first purchasing WalkMe Premium for SAP Ariba solutions. For more information about WalkMe Premium for SAP Ariba solutions, see https://walkme.com

If you have an SAP Companion help system enabled, its help content remains available.

View implementation details and more here.

 

AI Copilot Joule in Supplier Management (SLP-2258)
Joule, SAP's generative AI copilot, is now available in supplier management. Joule uses a conversational interface to help users complete tasks efficiently. It leverages generative and other AI technologies to understand natural language requests, identify intent, perform actions, and provide insights. Using generative AI, it can execute tasks, deliver tailored responses, and summarize information effectively.

(IMPORTANT: AI Copilot Joule in SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance will be in early access until September 19th, 2025, at which time it will be made generally available to customers.)

View implementation details and more here.

For the list of tasks that you can perform using Joule, refer to the topic Joule Capabilities in Supplier Management.

 

Option to Join the SAP User Research Panel (SRISK-1771)
This feature provides you an option to join the SAP User Research Panel, where you can share your thoughts and ideas to enhance SAP Ariba Supplier Risk and other SAP products you currently use.

View implementation details and more here.

 

Risk Exposure Summary Report Displays Overall Residual and Inherent Risk Levels (SRISK-1763)

This feature provides information about the inherent and residual risk levels of suppliers in the Risk Exposure Summary report. This crucial information aids in making informed decisions when engaging with suppliers.

In addition to the existing risk exposure information, the Risk Exposure Summary report now includes two additional columns to provide inherent and residual risk level information for the suppliers you monitor in SAP Ariba Supplier Risk.

Changes to the User Interface - Currently, the Risk Exposure Summary report summarizes the overall risk exposure, and category-wise risk exposure such as legal and regulatory, environmental and social, and operational risk exposure. This enhancement introduces two additional columns to display overall inherent risk level and residual risk level information for the suppliers you monitor in SAP Ariba Supplier Risk.

View implementation details and more here.

For further details on these innovations and more, view our blog: Supplier Management & Risk 2508 Release Key Innovations 

 

These innovations aim to significantly enhance your procurement and sourcing capabilities, leading to improved efficiency, data-driven insights, and strengthened supplier relationships.

entry.title: Transform Procurement with the SAP Ariba Business AI Accelerator
entry.content:
Gordon Donovan's, Global Vice President Research, Procurement & External Workforce at SAP, recent conversations with the Procurement Leaders, clearly states that we are currently living in a world of "Polycrisis" - a mix of geopolitical, environment and macroeconomics risks, where Procurement is right on the front lines. Instead of just focusing on cost savings, the role of procurement has become one of Risk Management and Strategic Value Creation and AI plays a critical role in making this shift possible.

These conversations emphasis that AI is a not a buzz word but is a critical tool for facing today's reality. The procurement leaders have pointed out the few key areas where AI plays a major role:

  • Enhanced Risk Management and Resilience
  • Strategic Decision-Making and Optimization
  • Automation and Productivity
  • Data-Driven Supplier Management

Ultimately, Donovan's discussions show that AI is not just about efficiency; it's about giving procurement leaders the intelligence and agility they need to thrive in a world full of interconnected risks. The real power of AI lies in its ability to transform procurement into a function that can anticipate and respond to change, rather than simply reacting to it.

We have the McKinsey's 2024-2025 research which supports these conversations.  AI is set to drive and redefine how the procurement operates, arrive at decisions and deliver value in an Organization. Their findings show that organizations where AI has been adopted early, they are seeing:

  • Up to 30% faster sourcing cycles
  • 5–10% reductions in spend
  • Over 20% improvements in contract compliance
  • Significant reduction in manual exception handling

These Research also identifies four important areas where adopting AI can make a major impact:

  1. Spend analysis and bundling strategies
  2. Supplier performance evaluation and ESG monitoring
  3. Automated RFP creation and negotiation
  4. Reducing value leakage across the Source-to-Pay cycle

Source (https://www.mckinsey.com/capabilities/operations/our-insights/revolutionizing-procurement-leveraging-data-and-ai-for-strategic-advantage

https://www.mckinsey.com/capabilities/operations/our-insights/where-is-procurement-heading-in-the-next-ten-years

https://www.mckinsey.com/capabilities/operations/our-insights/procurement-2025-reimagining-the-function-for-success)

SAP Ariba's embedded capabilities align closely with these areas, and it goes beyond when supported by SAP Joule and the Business AI Accelerator Service in Preferred Success.

Where AI Is Already Delivering Value in SAP Ariba

SAP Ariba was already into the AI Journey before generative AI became the focus in the technology world. The Solution was enabling meaningful automation through traditional Machine Learning AI. The functionalities are already live and in use today.

Guided Sourcing

  • Smart Event Creation helps sourcing leads get started faster by recommending event templates based on historical data
  • Supplier Recommendations suggest relevant, qualified suppliers using profile matching and past performance insights

The result: shorter sourcing cycles, better supplier outcomes, and more informed decisions.

Guided Buying

  • Personalized Product Recommendations surface the most relevant items for each user based on behaviors and role
  • Catalog Item Matching offers compliant alternatives when users search for off-catalog or non-preferred items

The result: increased compliance, reduced maverick spend, and a better buying experience overall.

These use cases represent just a portion of what’s possible. SAP’s AI in Procurement site offers a more comprehensive view for teams looking to explore beyond the basics: Visit SAP AI for Procurement

The Business AI Accelerator Service: What it is and why it matters?

The Business AI Accelerator Service in the Preferred Success isn't about introducing the Organizations to the new technology that is available in the solution. It’s a structured service which is designed to help organizations to start their journey with AI along with their SAP Solutions. It helps them to put AI into action by starting with the embedded capabilities and extending more strategic use cases through custom use case ideation.

Why customers use it:

  • To align AI initiatives with business goals
  • To identify use cases with measurable value
  • To understand how to implement AI responsibly
  • To support users through the transition with change enablement

What it includes:

SAP Business AI Essentials

We start with foundational education: What AI is (and isn’t), how it’s already embedded in SAP solutions, and how our Co-Pilot, SAP Joule enhance procurement operations.

Governance and Ethics Enablement

We provide a framework to ensure that AI initiatives are compliant, transparent, and aligned with SAP’s global principles for ethical AI. That includes privacy, fairness, and human oversight.

Change Management Support

Success with AI isn’t just about data—it’s about people. We provide guidance on how to prepare procurement teams for AI-driven workflows and address the common challenges in adoption

Use Case Discovery Workshop

In this session, we work with your team to identify pain points, assess feasibility, and prioritize use cases that deliver near-term ROI. This is a highly interactive, business-first discussion.

Where to Start:

You don’t need to perfectly define the plan to start the AI journey, our Business AI Accelerator service is designed to meet you on wherever you are in the AI Journey. Whether you're just brainstorming potential use cases or you've already got some ideas you want to validate, this service provides the clarity and expert guidance you need to move forward with confidence.

If you already have Preferred Success subscription for SAP Ariba, then starting with the service is easy. Reach out to your Customer Success Manager to learn more and schedule the sessions to help you unlock and start your AI Journey.

If you are not a Preferred Success Customer yet, simply get in touch with your SAP Partner or Account Representative. They can walk you through the available options to join the program and unlock this, and many other, valuable services.

Learn more about SAP Preferred Success and how it helps customers accelerate outcomes and reduce transformation risk
